001package ImageJ_Demos;
002
003import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
004
005import ij.IJ;
006import ij.ImagePlus;
007import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
008import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
009import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
010import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
011
012
013/**
014 * This plugin shows a trick how to automatically load some pre-defined sample
015 * image in the case that no other image is currently open. It works by defining
016 * a non-empty constructor which is invoked BEFORE ImageJ handles all the rest.
017 * All the remaining parts of the plugin remain unchanged.
018 * If the specified sample image is not of the proper type is will still be
019 * opened but the problem is subsequently detected by the setup() method.
020 */
021public class Open_Sample_Image_For_PlugInFilter implements PlugInFilter {
022        
023        /**
024         * Trick, using the (normally empty) constructor to check if a suitable image is
025         * already open or not, BEFORE ImageJ's internal machinery jumps in. In this
026         * case we open an image from an internal resource, but any other action could
027         * be performed. If this is not needed, just remove the constructor or make sure
028         * a suitable image is always open. The constructor must be public.
029         */
030        public Open_Sample_Image_For_PlugInFilter() {
031                if (noCurrentImage()) {
032                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.MapleLeafSmall);
033                }
034        }
035        
036        private ImagePlus im;
037
038        @Override
039        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
040                this.im = im;
041                return DOES_8G;
042        }
043
044        @Override
045        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
046                if (im != null) {
047                        IJ.log("processing " + im.getTitle());
048                }
049        }
050        
051}
